title: Raigad Fort
subtitle: The Capital of Shivaji Maharaj’s Maratha Empire
overview: Raigad Fort served as the capital of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj’s empire and is perched atop a hill in the Sahyadris. The fort holds immense historical significance and offers panoramic views.
Visitors can explore ruins of palaces, watchtowers, and temples, and take a ropeway to reach the fort’s summit.
It’s a popular destination for history buffs and trekkers alike, reflecting Maratha architecture and legacy.

highlights.title: Coronation Site
highlights.description: Shivaji Maharaj’s coronation took place here in 1674.

highlights.title: Ropeway Ride
highlights.description: Enjoy a quick 4-minute ropeway ride to the fort entrance.

highlights.title: Main Gate (Maha Darwaza)
highlights.description: Majestic stone gateway with massive arches and views.

highlights.title: Samadhi of Shivaji
highlights.description: Final resting place of the great Maratha king.

geography.intro: Raigad Fort is located in the Sahyadri hills of Maharashtra at a height of 1,356 meters above sea level.

climate.description: Raigad Fort enjoys cool and breezy weather year-round. The best time to visit is post-monsoon when the surroundings are lush and green.

geography.conclusion: Raigad combines natural beauty with political legacy—perfect for a culturally rich trek.
